reviewText: Peer assignment is like a trap here please do some changes,completed the whole course but didnt got the certificate
revIews suck
Contenu p√©dagogique avec beaucoup d'erreurs. Difficile de suivre un instructeur qui n'est pas visible...
Reading from slides only is not really exciting way of presenting the topic of HTAWorst of all Coursera Course I took

This class is a good introduction to the words and concepts for market analysis in the medical world. But the lecturer's pacing is awkward, the assignments are poorly worded, and (aside for isolated examples that are not contextualized to the rest of this course) the class doesn't explore many solutions for contemporary societal and ethical issues in medtech evaluation strategies.
Fairly basic. Instructor is dry.  Slides are just bulleted lists.
Bias towards the American healthcare system and deathly boring. Only take this course you have to.
Good content but the communication quality of the speaker is very low. Makes it more easy to just read the transcript than listening to the video.

This course is a good tool to learn in a very generic and theoric way what an HTA is. However, I think it lacks a lot in the way of providing the tools or information to be able to perform a simple cost-effectiveness study yourself. I think it should provide real examples where he analyses a real case in way more depth that what he does during the course, or the depth of one or some links where you can find some guidelines or something.
In the beginning the lecturer seemed to have to think of what he wanted to say, thus losing my attention.  Towards the end it got better - especially where it appears the lecture was redone.

The background and methods information were throughly convered and well organized. I thought the case study was a little vague and phylosophical. It was a very informative concept introduction course. I wish we had a hands on calculation practice.
Useful content, but presentation was slightly disorganised.

P‚Äãresenter could use some work on their oral presentation skills (the professor tended to ramble or stumble their speech). Contrast with the oral presentation of the professor in the Healthcare Marketplace course: clear, concise and complete sentences with no breaks in the flow of the presentation of an idea or xoncept. However, this did not get too much in the way of understanding the material.
It provide overall prospective for Medical device approvals and process.

It was a wonderful and well-structured course. I would like to suggest including more examples for module 4 and an assignment like what we had in module 3. something that really made me think, search, and help me understand the topics pretty well. all in all, thank you dear Coursera and the university of Minnesota.
Good content. But, I expected this course to be about technical analysis of medical technology rather than just cost, benefit, or effectivity analysis.
very good course
First couple of weeks, the instructor sounds a bit nervous which may make empathetic indiviuals uncomfortable.
it is best course to improve our knowledge
The last week is the more interestinig. More details would be appreciated

The concepts of economic evaluation in healthcare are well presented. People without any knowledge in health economics might find this quite heavy. Once you patiently digest them all, they are very helpful in understanding what economic evaluation is trying to achieve.
informative but will be useful only for advanced
Pretty good I though there was a bit to much overlap with Course 3, and I thought the assignment was a bit nebulous

Great understanding of how they make decisions... but if it was to be a career, in evaluation, having either practice exercises or better explanation of the equations (slower? more descriptive) would have helped me know what to do if ever presented with such a need. Thanks so much for another great class.

Very good summary course! The last multiple choice exam should incorporate some calculations to make sure that people really earn the certificate.e.g. calculate a real ICER, and run through the Bayes logic for interpreting test results which is a typical use. Markov & Monte Carlo are for real modelers - I agree it is too timeconsuming for pupils if this were actually to be tested and requires macros or other software tools like Vose or Oracle CB which aren't for free.Best regards, BK
Interesting course with really useful information. Learning of course is easy because of many examples offered by teacher.

One of the most interesting courses of the specialization. Unfortunately, delivery is still in need of improvement.  At least there was some good discussion around the slides, and not all slides were read verbatim.  Interesting project at the end!
Nice course. It would be better if the PPT could be modified (reduce the words, add more figures or diagrams).
Good content, engaging assignments and valuable points that allow the students to better understand all indicated points.
Quick and clear!
Great topic and great explanation by professors
good.
Very good course. Above expectations. I recommend.
Highly recommend this course for those who are new to Health technology assessment
LEARNT MANY THINGS.
Excellent course!
a‚Äãwesome
It was a good course through which i could learn new things.
great intro to med tech evaluation
Even though based in the Uk the course gives the fundamentals required in HTAs and inspires you to learn more. really happy with the content, structure and delivery of the material.
excellent information, very important topics
An excellent course, I learned a lot and I know that I can apply it to my work field, excellent work.
Very insightful and informative Course I must say!
This course was great learning experience.
Medical technology and evaluation in this course come under the specialization of healthcare market place specialization..I gained knowledge about the medical technology
Awesome material, great videos and activities
Really very informative and easily understandable \organised lectures! Recommended for those who wants to go in healthcare industry.
excellent course with very good speaker
I really like this course, I learn about cost and assessment to get the new technologies
very informative and competently done
The course content and explanation is really good.  Coursera is a good platform to learn new skills and it provides really excellent tool.

Excellent course with concise and to-the-pointmaterial and very focused instructor. Well done!
Thank you so much I learned a lot
Extremely valuable content.  I have seen very few places where so much information about Medical Technology development and regulation was provided in such a compact and well-organized place.
Excellent course ! Completely changed by concepts for the better !
I liked this course... its very useful and 4 weeks of learning the medical technology and evaluation gave me a strength to find the aspects of modern medical technology.
Excellent course! Has provided me with top-notch knowledge of the healthcare industry.
very useful course, amazing explanation. I wish luck for every one learn it.thanks
This course is a great tool to learn basics about health technology if you want to begin in this field. Thank you for the information, it was well explained and organized. I enjoyed my learning.

AMazing COntents. I learnt most of the anticipated learning materials from this course. I highly recommend other students who actually want to learn something innovative in their lives. This course has completely changed my perspective towards technological assessment.
The course is interesting and I hope to make best use of the knowledge.
excellent course
Good class, the teacher is very clear and the content pedagogic and coherently organized. The examination's topic was very interesting.
Who knew development of medical technology was scrutinized so much. Plus all the factors that are needed to be taken into account.
I continue to use what i've learned from this course to improve myself
I learned a lot from this course I am glad I was able to finish this class, thank you for the experience.
